page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND POPULATION
page.content: Our area of study is in the{Western {Valley of Gwent},which is part of the {South Wales Coalfield. The land of this area is that of mountains separated by valleys.The valleys have steep sides and are heavily forested both with natural beech and oak woods and with man_made coniferous forest.What flat land there is is heavily used chiefly for building. The area is both rural and urban,with part of{Abertillery}town in the southern section.Abertillery had a population of 30,000 in the early fifties but this has declined to 14,000 with an unemployment figure of 18% to 20%,mainly due to the closure of four collieries and associated heavy industries.{
